intro: Euthales pilosella, commonly known as the hairy mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It features small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Euthales pilosella is often found in disturbed areas and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
